Your opponents can't cast spells during your turn.

Choose one. If you control a commander as you cast this spell, you may choose both modes.
Creatures you control gain flying, vigilance and double strike until end of turn.
Creatures you control gain lifelink, indestructible and protection from all colours until end of turn.
3{R}{R}: Untap all creatures you control. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase. Activate only as a sorcery.

Whenever a creature you control attacks, defending player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
{3}{RW}{RW}: Creatures your opponents control block this turn if able, and you choose how those creatures block.
Attacking creatures you control have double strike.

At the beginning of your end step, you may sacrifice an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker. If you do, each opponent may sacrifice a permanent of their choice that shares a card type with it. For each opponent who doesn't, that player loses 2 life and you draw a card.

Indestructible [i](Damage and effects that say “destroy” don't destroy this.)[/i]
As long as your devotion to red and white is less than seven, this isn't a creature. [i](Each {R} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to red.)[/i]
Creatures you control have menace. [i](They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)[/i]
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to attacking creatures you control.

At the beginning of your first main phase, choose one or more —
• Sell Contraband — Create a Treasure token. You lose 1 life.
• Buy Information — Draw a card. You lose 2 life.
• Hire a Mercenary — Create a 3/2 colorless Shapeshifter creature token with changeling. You lose 3 life. [i](It is every creature type.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Relentless, bloodthirsty lizards Mundus created to assault the human world.[/i]

Draw two cards and lose 2 life.

Flash, haste
This creature has hexproof and first strike if it entered this turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]This sucker uses raw demonic power to do little space-time jumps. It'll warp right next to you and bite your face off before you can blink! Hope you got quick reflexes.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Gain a Stylish Rank. 
Creatures you control gain haste, first strike, and trample until end of turn.

Jackpot! deals 3 damage to target creature you don't control, plus one additional damage per Stylish Rank you have. Then if that creature has lethal damage and its mana value is higher than the number of Ranks you have, gain Ranks equal to the difference.

Gain a Stylish Rank.
Exile target creature you control. You may return it to the battlefield under your control [i](now)[/i]. If you don't, return it to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

[i]Cull the Weak[/i] — {1}, sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. It gains indestructible until end of turn.
[i]Unmask — [/i]{1}, sacrifice this creature: Move all counters from either this creature or target permanent onto another target creature.

At the end of your combat, gain a Stylish Rank, then gain another for each player who has lost the game.
If you would gain a Rank while your Rank is already SSS, this enchantment deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life instead.

Flying, lifelink
Whenever Mundus enters or attacks, destroy target creature, then create a token copy of target creature card in a graveyard.
When this battle enters, create Griffon, a legendary black 3/3 Devil Bird creature token with flying. Then return target creature card from a graveyard to the battlefield under your control.
Whenever Damned Bishop attacks, choose odd or even. Put a +1/+1 counter on each nontoken creature you control with a chosen mana value.

cards.rules_text:
Gain Stylish Rank and flip a coin. 
For each player [i](including you)[/i], exile target nonland permanent they control. If your Stylish Rank is A or higher, return your permanent to the battlefield.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Leave it to fate. Heads, I go. Tails, you go.”[/i]
cards.notes:
New

The coin flip does nothing. Dante's coin was heads on both sides.
